name: somersault
content:

a rolling movement or jump, either forwards or backwards, in which you turn over completely, with your body above your head, and finish with your head on top again: Do you want to see me do a somersault? She was so happy she turned three somersaults on the lawn. Synonym

[ I ] to roll or jump, either forwards or backwards, turning over completely, with your body above your head, and finish with your head on top again: Acrobats somersaulted across the stage. He was supposed to crouch on the floor and wait for a large girl named Maureen to somersault over him.
[ I or T ] to turn over completely, or to make something do this: The bus plunged down the embankment, somersaulted twice, and finally landed on its side. The driver went out of control and somersaulted his car into a knot of onlookers. Synonyms
cartwheel
flip (TURN)
overturn (GO UPSIDE DOWN)
turn (CHANGE POSITION)
More examplesFewer examplesHe would somersault off the elephants' backs into the river.Her horse somersaulted over the fence and fell on her.You need a good kite that somersaults easilyThree women died instantly when the bus somersaulted into a ditch.
